perturbation.original_text: Licensee agrees that the business operated by it in connection with the Licensed Mark shall comply with all laws, rules, regulations and requirements of any governmental body in the Territory or elsewhere as may be applicable to the operation, marketing, and promotion of the business and shall notify Licensor of any action that must be taken by Licensee to comply with such law, rules, regulations or requirements.
perturbation.changed_text: Licensee agrees to use reasonable efforts to comply with laws, rules, regulations and requirements of any governmental body in the Territory applicable to the business, marketing, and promotion. Notification to Licensor regarding compliance shall occur only if Licensee deems it necessary.
perturbation.explanation: By adding 'reasonable efforts' and changing the mandatory notification requirement to a discretionary one, the Licensee's obligation to strictly adhere to all applicable laws is weakened. This creates a loophole where the licensee can claim to have made 'reasonable efforts' even if non-compliance occurs. The New York law requires strict compliance with all regulations in business operations.
perturbation.contradicted_law: New York State laws and regulations related to business operation and marketing compliance, potentially violating consumer protection laws and investment regulations, such as the Martin Act.

perturbation.original_text: Each party shall immediately notify the other party and provide to the other party all relevant background facts upon becoming aware of (a) any registrations of, or applications for registration of, marks in the Territory that do or may conflict with the Licensor’s rights in the Licensed Mark or the rights granted to the Licensee under this Agreement, (b) any infringements or misuse of the Licensed Mark in the Territory by any third party (“Third Party Infringement”), or (c) any claim that Licensee’s use of the Licensed Mark infringes the intellectual property rights of any third party in the Territory (“Third Party Claim”). Licensor shall have the exclusive right, but not the obligation, to prosecute, defend and/or settle in its sole discretion, all actions, proceedings and claims involving any Third Party Infringement or Third Party Claim, and to take any other action that it deems necessary or proper for the protection and preservation of its rights in the Licensed Mark.
perturbation.changed_text: Each party shall notify the other party upon becoming aware of (a) registrations of conflicting marks or (b) Third Party Infringement, or (c) Third Party Claim. Licensor shall have the right, but not the obligation, to prosecute, defend and/or settle in its sole discretion, all actions, proceedings and claims involving any Third Party Infringement or Third Party Claim.
perturbation.explanation: The removal of 'immediately' and 'provide to the other party all relevant background facts' weakens the notification requirement. Also, the licensee's obligation to provide relevant background facts, which is essential for protecting the trademark, has been removed, potentially violating New York's trademark protection laws.
perturbation.contradicted_law: New York General Business Law regarding trademark protection and the obligation to report infringements.

perturbation.original_text: This Agreement shall be governed by, and construed in accordance with, the laws of the State of New York. The parties unconditionally and irrevocably consent to the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts located in the State of New York and waive any objection with respect thereto, for the purpose of any action, suit or proceeding arising out of or relating to this Agreement or the transactions contemplated hereby.
perturbation.changed_text: This Agreement shall be governed by the laws of the State of New York.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the clause regarding consent to the exclusive jurisdiction of New York courts and waiver of objections, the contract opens the possibility of disputes being litigated in other jurisdictions, potentially disadvantaging one party depending on the location. This could contradict principles of contractual certainty under New York law if the parties intended to have disputes resolved in New York.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Principles of contractual interpretation and enforcement under New York law, particularly regarding forum selection clauses.
